str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A plot, design against. From a presumed compound of epi and boulomai; a plan against someone, i.e. A plot.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To watch, observe scrupulously. From para and tereo; to inspect alongside, i.e. Note insidiously or scrupulously.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A gate. Apparently a primary word; a gate, i.e. The leaf or wing of a folding entrance.
From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ana and haireomai; to take up, i.e. Adopt; by implication, to take away, i.e. Abolish, murder.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
